description: Dive into "Malaga's Enchanted Escapes for Lovers" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Malaga's Enchanted Escapes for Lovers

places.generalDescription: Muelle Uno is a vibrant open-air complex located along a waterfront promenade in Malaga. The area features contemporary shops, restaurants, and various attractions such as playgrounds and a maritime museum. Additionally, visitors can explore the compact Centre Pompidou gallery showcasing 20th-century art, including works by Picasso. On the second Sunday of every month, Muelle Uno hosts an excellent flea market offering ecological foods and vintage clothing. Local artisans also showcase their work at stalls every Sunday.

sources.snippet: -Muelle Uno: Next to the city port, it offers beautiful sea views and a glimpse of the city centre. It features a wide variety of shops and restaurants where you can enjoy a drink by the sea. At the end of the pier, you’ll find the lighthouse “La Farola,” where you can watch the city lights gradually illuminate the sea as the sun sets.
sources.shortName: 8 Romantic Activities to Enjoy in Málaga

sources.snippet: Maybe it’s because of the sailors who had to say goodbye to their loved ones before leaving on a new sea voyage?. There is one thing we are sure about – Muelle Uno and Port of Malaga are perfect places for a date!. This fashionable area of Malaga offers you a wide choice of things you can do.
sources.shortName: 7 most romantic spots in Malaga

sources.snippet: Located at the port, Muelle Uno Market is a trendy spot where you can find local crafts, fashion, and gourmet food. The lively atmosphere and beautiful setting make it a great place to spend a few hours shopping and enjoying the views of the marina.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Malaga for Couples

sources.snippet: After your journey across the Alborán Sea, head to Muelle Uno—the port’s commercial area—to carry on the fun with a beer, some tapas and perhaps some gift shopping to surprise each other.
sources.shortName: A romantic break in Málaga for couples

sources.snippet: Muelle Uno always has a lively atmosphere; you’ll often see street singers and people having a few drinks with friends on an outdoor terrace and taking photos.
sources.shortName: 22 Unique Things To Do In Malaga For Couples
Romantic Things for Couples to Do in Malaga
5 romantic things to do in Malaga
Romantic things to do in Malaga

places.name: Muelle Uno

reviews.text:
It's a wonderful place whether you want to take a walk or enjoy a meal or a drink. There's a wide selection of restaurants offering various cuisines and price ranges-from elegant dining spots to affordable fast-food options. The view of the moored yachts adds to the relaxing atmosphere as you sit at the restaurant tables.

In this promenade, you'll also find several clothing and shoe stores, shops for fans of Spanish sports clubs, and souvenir stores. Regularly, various artisan markets are held here, showcasing unique regional products. And just a few steps away, you'll find yourself at the iconic Malagueta.
Just cruised past onan1 hour scenic cruise with not much to see. Cruise terminal looks closed for redevelopment
Very lively and needs an early evening trip .. so much to do and see and the underground parking is very cheap .. street kiosk shopping to restaurants with live music .. it's truly a must visit

places.address: P.º del Muelle Uno, 4, Distrito Centro, 29016 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Perched majestically on a hilltop, the Alcazaba is a stunning Moorish-style fortress that offers breathtaking views of the sea and lush gardens adorned with fountains. Constructed in the mid-8th century atop Roman ruins, this well-preserved citadel rivals even Granada's Alhambra in charm.

sources.snippet: Alcazaba to the majesty of Gibralfaro Castle.The city has a unique blend of history and charm, combined with the great buildings and facilities that have been built throughout the city to provide all residents and visitors with the best services that a modern destination requires. The options for couples are endless. From romantic walks along the Malagueta beach, with its vibrant sunsets painted in warm tones, to intimate dinners in local restaurants that combine Mediterranean culinary tradition with gastronomic innovation.
sources.shortName: 7 romantic Malaga experiences | Blog

sources.snippet: From the mountaintop you will see a panoramic view of romantic Malaga, an ideal place to capture the moment as a couple with a picture to remember. For its part, the Alcazaba fortress is a palace full of history and of Muslim origin. Nearby are the Roman Theatre and the Customs building, which joins in a few meters the Muslim, Roman and Renaissance cultures.
sources.shortName: 5 magical places in Malaga to say I love you

sources.snippet: This 11th-century Moorish fort is the perfect adventure for two lovebirds, as it comes complete with secret squares and alleyways to explore to your heart’s content. When you are finished exploring, you can finish your time off at Alcazaba and enjoy the views while you sit on the ramparts. This sure to be a romantic day for the both of you.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things to Do in Malaga
5 romantic things to do in Malaga
22 Unique Things To Do In Malaga For Couples
15 Romantic Things to Do in Malaga for Couples

places.name: Alcazaba

reviews.text:
The Alcazaba of Málaga is a true gem of Andalusian history and architecture. Perched on a hill overlooking the city and the port, this Moorish fortress offers not only a fascinating glimpse into the Islamic past of Spain but also some of the best panoramic views in Málaga.

The structure is remarkably well-preserved, with beautiful arches, lush gardens, and quiet courtyards that invite you to slow down and imagine what life was like centuries ago. The blend of military strength and delicate design is stunning - especially the intricate stonework and the refreshing water features scattered throughout the site.
PS:
A beautiful and peaceful place with great views over Málaga. The architecture and gardens are stunning, and it's perfect for a short historical visit. Highly recommended!

Beautiful. Fabulous views, well preserved.
€6 adult entry.
Uphill, and some of it steep.
Need a good head for heights at times.
Cafe and a few sets of toilets inside.
Nice fountain courtyard to sit and chill.
Great vantage points to take photos and view Malaga or the port.
Not too busy.

Short queue to enter on a hot Sunday. Was €7 each to go in. The ruins are immense, spread out over multiple layers and over a wide area. The views are incredible. There are so many features to see - gardens, walls, water features, galleries, etc. absolutely worth a visit. Seeing the uncovered Roman amphitheatre was a bonus too. Amazing place to visit.

places.address: C/ Alcazabilla, 2, Distrito Centro, 29012 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled within a stunning 1791 building that echoes the grandeur of Italian palaces, the Malaga Museum stands as a cultural gem in the heart of Andalusia. As the largest museum in Malaga, it offers an impressive collection of artworks spanning various eras, showcasing masterpieces from renowned global artists alongside local talents. Visitors can immerse themselves in an interactive experience that goes beyond mere observation, making each visit memorable and engaging.

sources.snippet: Del Pintor Suites & Hotels is located at number 27 Calle Álamos, in the center of Malaga, in the “Barrio de Picasso”, a few steps from the so-called monumental and artistic triangle of Malaga (Picasso Museum, Roman Theater-Alcazaba monumental complex and the Museum of Malaga, in the spectacular Palacio De La Aduana). A privileged situation to discover the center of Malaga on foot.
sources.shortName: Romantic getaway to the Costa del Sol

places.name: Malaga Museum

reviews.text:
Amazing museum please visit once in Malaga.
For EU citizens it's for free
People from other countries pay 1,5 euros
It's two floors one for Arts and the second for archeology. Very interesting!!

For me this museum wasn't that interesting - there are mostly painting from Spanish artists and if you don't know that much about local art, you probably won't enjoy it that much. The archeological part of the museum was more interesting for me. Also, it's situated in a really beautiful building that is worth seeing!

Really enjoyed the timeline of Spanish art's rise and development. The archaeological piece, the telling of the area's change in hands and the impact on the people here was also very interesting. What is super fun is that I visited the botanical gardens and saw the influential family's initial "museum" of local archaeological finds and they are all on display here, in person. Very interesting.

places.address: Plaza de la Aduana, Distrito Centro, 29015 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Málaga, Parque de Málaga is a stunning urban oasis that first opened its doors in 1897. Spanning an impressive 33 hectares, this lush green space features beautifully landscaped botanical gardens, enchanting fountains, and captivating sculptures that invite exploration. The park stretches over 30,000 square meters between Alameda Principal and Paseo de España, connecting Plaza del General Torrijos to Plaza de la Marina.

sources.snippet: On this tour, you will visit the Malaga Park, the Paseo de la Farola, the Paseo Marítimo, the Plaza de Toros and the Paseo de Reding, among others.
sources.shortName: Romantic getaway to the Costa del Sol

places.name: Málaga Park

reviews.text: Beautiful park in the city centre. It has a lot of different kinds of plants. There are a lot of benches to rest and enjoy beautiful nature in the city centre. Amazing park with nice pathways and a lot of trees to just look and enjoy. Definitely worth it to take some takeaway and go there to eat lunch and just enjoy.
Nice garden area with loads of parrots flying around. Very hard to see them, but you can definitely hear them! Plenty of shade to hide from the sun too!
Beautiful park that is home to many exotic plants as well as local birds. It's well maintained and allowing a nice walk in the shade during the day time. Additionally it acts as a lung to the city.

places.address: Paseo del Parque, 1, Distrito Centro, 29015 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled atop a hill just outside the bustling center of Malaga, the Mirador de Gibralfaro is an enchanting lookout point that promises breathtaking views of both the city and the shimmering Mediterranean Sea. Accessible by foot or bus, this scenic spot invites you to embark on a delightful journey through tree-lined paths, especially magical at sunrise or sunset when the landscape transforms into a canvas of colors.

sources.shortName: 22 Unique Things To Do In Malaga For Couples

places.name: Mirador de Gibralfaro

reviews.text:
Climbing the winding path up to Gibralfaro Castle, the scent of pine trees mixes with the salty breeze drifting from the Mediterranean. With each step, the city of Málaga stretches wider beneath you - its whitewashed houses, its busy port, and the deep blue sea reaching into the horizon.

The fortress walls, sturdy yet graceful, trace the ridges of the hill like guardians of memory. Walking along the ramparts, you feel the weight of centuries under your feet - Moorish soldiers once keeping watch, Christian kings later claiming the same heights, all leaving their echoes in the stones.

Inside, open courtyards bathe in sunlight, and the rough stone walls are softened by wildflowers growing between the cracks. The silence is broken only by the call of seabirds circling overhead and the laughter of visitors leaning against the battlements, capturing views that painters and poets once tried to preserve.

From the highest tower, the panorama is breathtaking: the bullring below, the cathedral rising proudly in the heart of the city, and beyond it all, the endless shimmer of the sea. It is a view that ties past and present together - a reminder of Málaga's resilience, its mixture of cultures, and the timeless embrace of land and water.

Leaving Gibralfaro, you don't just carry photographs. You carry a memory: of wind in your hair, sun on the ancient stones, and the feeling of having stood at a crossroads where history still breathes.

The view from the top is fantastic, but honestly, it doesn't quite justify the effort of climbing all the way up. **Here's a tip:** take a **taxi or a city bus** to the top instead of hiking. Then, instead of following the crowded tourist path back down, take a slightly longer but much quieter route that leads you **directly to the sea**. You'll end up at a **small beachfront restaurant**, where you can enjoy a coffee with a perfect ocean view-**a much better way to end the experience.**

great view with a lovely walk up from the northern side. getting there requires no ticket and is completely free of any charge, except for spending some energy walking there ;) the view on a sunny day was great and offered an alternative sight of the city from higher up. the walk up from the southern side on top of the wall is very steep, is very unaccessible to impaired people!

places.address: Cam. Gibralfaro, s/n, Distrito Centro, 29016 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Perched majestically atop Mount Gibralfaro, the Castillo de Gibralfaro is a stunning remnant of Malaga's Moorish heritage. Originally constructed in the 8th century and later rebuilt in the 14th century, this fortress served as both a military stronghold and a lighthouse. While much of its interior has been altered over time, visitors can stroll along its protective ramparts to enjoy breathtaking panoramic views of the city below.

sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Malaga

places.name: Castillo de Gibralfaro

reviews.text: Well worth the strenuous hike up (can get there by road, I believe). Very well maintained walls of the old castle. You can walk pretty much the entire length and the views are spectacular. Not a ton inside the castle walls, but the views alone make this a must do. Free on a Sunday after 2 pm. It'll be nice and quiet if you go before that and pay.

Great place to visit, but be prepared for a LOT of uphill walking. If you go in summer, bring super comfortable sneakers, a hairband, and plenty of water. The view from the top is absolutely breathtaking! They even provide fresh tap water at the hilltop for free, so don't forget to bring a bottle or flask. The total cost is €17 to visit the main castle and the hilltop. You can drive up, but walking is more fun and a great workout. I did the walk in 34°C in August-and I survived!

If you're looking to enjoy a breathtaking panoramic view of the city and the beautiful coastline, I highly recommend visiting this castle. The view from the top is truly impressive and well worth the trip.

You can hike up to the castle if you're in the mood for some exercise, the path is uphill and quite steep, so it's a good little workout. But if walking isn't ideal for you, there's also a bus available that will take you right up to the castle.

Whether you're into photography, sightseeing, or just enjoying a peaceful moment with a view, this spot is absolutely worth a visit.

places.address: Cam. Gibralfaro, 11, Distrito Centro, 29016 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Museo Carmen Thyssen Málaga is a captivating art museum housed in a 16th-century Renaissance palace. It showcases an extensive collection of Spanish and international masterpieces from the personal collection of Carmen Thyssen-Bornemisza. The museum focuses on 19th-century Spanish art, featuring works by renowned artists such as Francisco de Goya and Pablo Picasso. While Andalusian art takes center stage, the museum also boasts significant pieces from beyond Spain.

sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Malaga for Couples

places.name: Museo Carmen Thyssen Málaga

reviews.text: What a wonderful museum! They have an excellent selection of art across four floors, each filled with paintings from different eras. It was a delightful experience to soak in the beauty of Andalusian art.

A truly exquisite experience, soaking up the history and storytelling of this wonderful Spanish art. Paintings of landscapes that will make you consider how simple a life we once led; breathtaking portraits of a simpler, tougher and more precious time. The details are a wonder to behold; light through a breaking wave, smoke from a cigar, despair on an old lady's face; and I guarantee you will want to spend time, slowing down and appreciating the work on display here. A special memory of Málaga and Spain. Thank you to the staff and curators.

A wonderful cozy museum. We have fallen in love with Spanish paintings. The museum shop has a great amount and a good variety of books about art (and for children too!) and different useful souvenirs!

places.address: Plaza Carmen Thyssen, Calle Compañía, 29008 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Hammam Al Ándalus Baños Árabes is a luxurious retreat in Malaga, offering a serene experience amidst elegant Arabesque architecture. The interior resembles a Moorish palace with its marble floors and intricately tiled walls and ceilings. The venue prioritizes cleanliness and comfort, providing cold, warm, and hot pools, steam sauna, and heated massage tables made of marble. Visitors can rejuvenate with the thermal baths followed by an invigorating scrub.

sources.snippet: If you’d rather unwind and relax, enveloped by a Moorish atmosphere, book an afternoon in the Hammam Al-Andalus. These Arab Baths, located near the Iglesia de los Mártires, in the city centre, offer several experiences, such as massages with different essential oils, and numerous kinds of baths. This is the best way to spend a relaxing Valentine’s Day with your partner in Malaga.
sources.shortName: Top Romantic Spots in Malaga for Valentine's Day

sources.snippet: For a truly relaxing experience, visit Hammam Al Ándalus, a traditional Arabic bathhouse. Enjoy the tranquil ambiance, soothing baths, and rejuvenating massages. This is the perfect way to unwind and connect with your partner in a serene and luxurious setting.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Malaga for Couples

sources.snippet: In the center of town you'll find the Hammam Al-Andalus, a beautiful spa just steps away from Calle Larios. Here you can enjoy 90 minutes of the baths which are designed in the traditional Nazari style with beautiful tilework and fantastic sky lights.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things To Do In Malaga to Woo Your Special Someone
8 Romantic Activities to Enjoy in Málaga

places.name: Hammam Al Ándalus Baños Árabes

reviews.text: It was an amazing relaxing experience. I felt like Cleopatra, a queen that takes care of her body with such care. I love this amazing baths. I also had the courage to take 2 min of a cold one. The architecture is stunning. All the candles and the warm makes the best cozy place to relax. I enjoyed the nice tea and I was surprised by one as a present to enjoy it at home. At the end I had everything for a shower: gel, shampoo and conditioner. After it was a nice place for getting ready and straighten your hair if you wanted. It was so relaxing that I think I left my thoughts melting on the candles fire. The massage and the scrubbing moment were activating my linfatic system and relaxing me even more. The place combine 4 natural elements: fire, air, water, wood.

Such an amazing experience! We had massage for 15 min and the baths for 1,5 hours. The money which you pay worth it :)
Massage from Isabel was super relaxing 🤩
I felt soooo good after ❤️

Definitely recommend to visit if you're in Malaga 🫶🏻

Treat yourself,  great service, lovely professional staff, normally 15 min treatments, we paid a little extra for 30mins body scrub 30 massage, clean, relaxing, secure lockers, recommend you book a few days ahead. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

places.address: Pl. de los Mártires Ciriaco y Paula, 5, Distrito Centro, 29008 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Cambara is a charming restaurant located in the heart of Muelle Uno, offering a delightful dining experience. The restaurant's beautiful decor and stunning location make it a must-visit spot. Their menu features an array of delectable seafood, steak dishes, burgers, and sandwiches. Guests can also enjoy a wide variety of delicious cocktails. The portions are generous and the presentation is impressive, providing great value for money. The friendly staff ensures that English-speaking guests feel welcome and accommodated.

sources.shortName: 8 Romantic Activities to Enjoy in Málaga

places.name: Cambara

reviews.text:
We absolutely love this place! Every time we've been here the service, food, and atmosphere were great. We definitely can recommend octopus and paella. The cocktails are more on the sweeter side, so if you prefer a balanced less sweet option, make sure to ask for more lime/lemon juice or less syrup. We definitely recommend this place!

Also, special shout-out to Gabriel (visit on 13.6.2025) for his great service and friendliness.

We absolutely LOVED IT! Great Service, great Ambiente, friendly employees. The food is awesome - looks and tastes amazing. Special thanks to our lovely waitress Tatiana! She was the best and very attentive and friendly. Thank you very much, you made our visit in the restaurant (4 times in 10 days!) perfect. Kind regards from Alemania :)

A visit to this restaurant is more than just a meal, it's a genuine Spanish experience. From the moment you arrive, there's an unmistakable warmth, not just in the atmosphere, but in the people, the energy, and the way everything flows naturally.

We ordered five different dishes from the starters, and absolutely every single one was delicious. It's rare to find that kind of consistency across the board, and it speaks volumes about the care and quality behind the scenes.

Absolutely worth coming here. We will definitely be back soon.

places.address: CC Muelle Uno, P.º del Muelle Uno, Local 65, Distrito Centro, 29016 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Montes de Málaga Natural Park, located just 5 kilometers north of the city of Malaga, is a vast natural paradise with a rich history dating back to prehistoric times. This 4,996-hectare park was once used for timber production and agriculture and is now considered the "lung" of the surrounding areas.

sources.snippet: Malaga, with its stunning coastline, vibrant cultural scene, and rich history, provides countless opportunities for couples to create lasting memories. From intimate dining experiences to exploring ancient castles and relaxing on pristine beaches, this city is brimming with romance. Let’s delve into the most romantic activities that will make your trip to Malaga truly special.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Malaga for Couples

sources.snippet: Located 50 minutes from Malaga city centre, hiking in Los Montes de Malaga is one of the best things to do in Malaga for couples who want to connect with nature.
sources.shortName: 22 Unique Things To Do In Malaga For Couples

places.name: Montes de Málaga Natural Park

reviews.text: A walk in the hills which at any time of the year affords clean air and stunning views, and in May and June floral displays which are glorious. Follow the Malaga road out of Colemenar until you encounter the bar Venta Pinar and a saw mill. Park behind the pub. The walk starts there.

We were quite surprised by how unsuited for cars the roads were as soon as we entered the park (not that it's a bad thing, just surprising). We drove some kilometers into the park anyway, parked the car and proceeded by foot. The park itself is great for hiking and the nature in there is nice, clean and untouched - I'm sure in part due to its less approachable nature :) The park is well worth a visit, and walks can be done by people of all ages - we even brought 3 small kids and a stroller..

Looking for a day away from the hustle and bustle of the beach and city. Montes de Malaga is wonderful retreat to nature. Lose yourself on the numerous pathways and cycle routes. Enjoy panoramic views from quaint, rustic cafes and restaurants along the main road. A perfect place for nature lovers.

places.address: Casabermeja-Colmenar, Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: El Pimpi is a must-visit in Malaga, known as an iconic meeting place for locals and tourists alike. Established in 1971 within an 18th-century mansion, it is surrounded by significant historical and cultural landmarks such as the Alcazaba, Roman Theatre, Picasso Museum, and Plaza de la Merced. This historic winery offers a taste of local gastronomy and wines while immersing visitors in the tradition and culture of southern Spain.

sources.snippet: , a curious network of internal courtyards, narrow corridors, bars, dining rooms and terraces, is one of Málaga’s best-loved eateries. Its outside terrace, which is efficiently serviced by an army of scurrying waiters, looks out over the Alcazaba and the Roman amphitheatre, making it the perfect spot for a romantic meal or pre-dinner cocktail. On the way through the bar to the terrace, check out the old wine barrels that have been signed by El Pimpi’s famous patrons, among whom is local boy
sources.shortName: 12 Of The Most Romantic Spots In Mlaga

sources.snippet: El Pimpi, for example, is a classic destination for visitors to Málaga. Sweeten your love story even more among flowers and typical Andalusian courtyards.
sources.shortName: A romantic break in Málaga for couples

places.name: Bodega El Pimpi.

reviews.text:
Been to El Pimpi bar 2-3 times. We usually sit on the terrace as inside is too busy.
It's like mutliple rooms and decors and SO many peoole walking around. Hectic but fun atmosphere.
The terrace is in the back and quite big! It has a view of the nearby ruins so pretty nice spot.
Found is not the best i have had but pretty fair for the location and vibe. Menu was big enough with all the main generic tapas. I definitely recommend everyone to try this place at least once. You don't go there only for food, but more for the atmosphere and central location.
Could sit and eat for hours chilling under the sun on the terrace.
Cocktails seem delicious but we mainly had wine.
Service was good.

We had dinner at El Pimpi and were excited to experience one of Málaga's most iconic spots. The atmosphere is undeniably charming-vibrant, full of character, and beautifully located in the heart of the old town. The restaurant was packed, and while that's a good sign, it did affect the service. We only saw our waiter when he took our order, and another brought us the bill, which made it feel a bit impersonal.

We shared the Mediterranean salad, and tried both the sea bream and the chicken. The dishes arrived hot and fresh, which we appreciated. The flavours were a bit on the mild side-not bland in a bad way, but definitely understated. That said, we'd rather season our own food than be overwhelmed by salt.

Overall, the food was good, but not particularly memorable. You come here more for the experience and ambiance than for a standout culinary moment. Worth a visit if you want to soak in the local vibe, but maybe not a place we'd rush back to for the food alone.

This is a truly special place. We arrived a bit early, as it can get very busy, and I'm glad we did. The service was spot on-absolutely nothing more we could have asked for. And the food… what can I say? It was amazing! Generous portions and incredible flavor made for a perfect meal. Highly recommended. Special mention to Javi that works there and recommended what to eat. We'll be back!

places.address: C. Granada, 62, Distrito Centro, 29015 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Port of Málaga is a vibrant blend of contemporary facilities and rich history, making it an essential stop for any traveler. As you wander along the picturesque waterfront, you'll discover the modern Muelle Uno shopping complex, where you can indulge in retail therapy or savor delicious meals with stunning views. This lively port serves as a fantastic launch point for boat tours that offer breathtaking perspectives of Málaga from the sea—keep your eyes peeled for playful dolphins during these excursions!

sources.snippet: Of course, you can’t visit Malaga without finishing your visit with a stroll around the beautiful port of Malaga. End your day on the streets of Malaga with a leisurely stroll along the Muelle Uno.
sources.shortName: 7 romantic Malaga experiences | Blog

places.name: Port of Málaga

reviews.text: The beach port offers a vibrant atmosphere with beautiful views and lively maritime activity. It's well-maintained, with great facilities, making it a pleasant spot for both relaxation and exploration.

The Port of Málaga is a modern, pleasant waterfront area, ideal for a relaxing stroll. Between luxury yachts, cruise ships, and the lively Muelle Uno promenade, it offers a perfect mix of leisure, shopping, and dining. Clean, well-maintained, and vibrant, it's a must-visit spot to enjoy the sunset or simply unwind by the sea.

We were so tired when we got here after touring 2 museums. The excitement of this area perked us right up! Beautiful scenery, sailboats, yachts, artist market, dining and shopping. A really fun spot to visit.

places.address: Spain

places.generalDescription: The Málaga Roman Theatre is a contemporary museum located at an ancient Roman theater site. The theater, dating back to the 1st century and built during the reign of Emperor Augustus, is currently undergoing restoration and preservation by archaeologists. It is conveniently situated in Málaga's historic center, near major attractions such as the Alcazaba and Gibralfaro Castle.

sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Malaga for Couples
Romantic things to do in Malaga

places.name: Málaga Roman Theatre

reviews.text: Well it just stays there. Visiting the Roman theater ruins was an unforgettable experience. The site is well-preserved enough to spark the imagination, allowing you to picture how grand and lively it must have been in ancient times. Walking among the stone seating and arches feels like stepping back in history. It's a must-see for anyone who enjoys culture, history, or simply beautiful places with a story to tell.

This was a wonderful find. It was free to visit, there was lots to look at and it was all very well preserved and very well maintained. The area's lower down were clearly visible from the flat area at the front. For those who are willing to climb the steps there is a fantastic view of the whole city from the top.is would not be easily accessible to families with pushchairs or those who have a disability. There is some shade at certain points but much of this is in the sun.

Free of charge, the city's oldest historical site locates right in the heart of Malaga next to the Alcazaba.
You will first enter a visitor centre, which tells you all about the history and structure of the theatre, very informative. You would then see the ruin after exiting the centre.
Went in March, not crowded at all(maybe because it's raining), on a warm sunny day, you could sit on the top and enjoy the scene as much as you want.

places.address: C/ Alcazabilla, s/n, Distrito Centro, 29015 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Batik is a modern and stylish restaurant located on the fourth floor of Premium Hotel in Malaga. It offers a laid-back dining experience with global dishes and desserts, complemented by an extensive wine list. The restaurant features a stunning rooftop terrace with panoramic views of Castillo de Gibralfaro, adding to its charm. With its sophisticated atmosphere and unique location within the Alcazaba Premium Hostel, Batik has quickly gained popularity as one of the best-rated restaurants in Malaga.

sources.snippet: Batik Restaurant – on the top floor of Alcazaba Premium Hostel, this rooftop terrace has great views of the Alcazaba Fortress and a good soundtrack.
sources.shortName: 5 romantic things to do in Malaga
8 Romantic Activities to Enjoy in Málaga

places.name: Batik

reviews.text: We had a lovely dinner at Batik. Everything we ordered was good, the service was above average. I don't normally order dessert but since everything else was quite good I decided on the brownie and my husband got the cheesecake. Both excellent.

Nice place with a restaurant on 5th floor also a rooftop terrace bar on the 6th floor. We had an early diner all dishes were good we had corvina, salmon, lomo de cerdo the best ones. Nice view on the city and on the Alcazaba. Amazing cocktails try return from Italy.

Such a great place to have a drink specially at night since it has a great view to the castle in Málaga! The price of the cocktails is also reasonable I would definitely recommend if you're visiting the city and want to have a great background it's excellent

places.address: C/ Alcazabilla, 12, Distrito Centro, 29015 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Restaurante Matiz offers a sophisticated and elegant dining experience with a Mediterranean cuisine. The restaurant is part of the Hotel Molina Lario, and features several tasting menus as well as wine pairing options.

sources.snippet: If you’re looking for an elegant and welcoming space, sophisticated cuisine and impeccable service, Restaurante Matiz (part of Hotel Molina Lario) will exceed your expectations. The menu features traditional Mediterranean recipes with subtle ‘matices’ (or nuances, as its name suggests) of the avant garde. If you want to elevate your experience even further, you can opt for the gastronomic menu which is paired with wines from the province.
sources.shortName: The most romantic restaurants in Malaga

places.name: Restaurante Matiz

reviews.text: Best restaurant in Malaga. They use local ingredients, amazing taste and beautiful plate decor. Our waiter Miguel was exceptional. We loved the restaurant and the great hospitality so much that we came back in the same week. Thank you!

Had a lovely dinner here on a sleepy Monday night. We particularly enjoyed the sautéed vegetables, the cannelloni, and the desserts (sponge cake and chocolates). Honestly the desserts were the highlight of the meal. The bread was also very tasty.

A warning for folks-the carrot soup is really more of a seafood soup, it tastes like what I would call “ocean brine.” I actually loved the cockles in the briny soup and I usually don't like clams served cold at all. But the soup itself should be more of a garnish than a soup… No idea who's going to be able to eat more than a couple bites of that!

Also a note for the restaurant-we were seated at a table by the back wall that was extremely brightly lit. In particular the strip lighting near the floor bothered my partner throughout the dinner. Perhaps remove a few lights? Never met a restaurant that needed any white lights whatsoever :)

I must say…Matiz used to be one of my favorite spots - for casual dining and hosting events, but after today's visit, I've definitely changed my mind….. Quite disappointed, to be honest.

The change in team and management has clearly impacted the overall dining experience. The atmosphere no longer feels warm or welcoming-hospitality felt rushed and impersonal, and the energy of the space now feels overly masculine and commercial.

The food quality is still good, don't get me wrong. But the lunch menu option isn't as good as it used to be

Just wanna share some honest thoughts.

places.address: C. Bolsa, 14, Distrito Centro, 29015 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: If you're in Málaga and seeking a rejuvenating experience, look no further than Sadhana Massage Málaga Center. This gem offers an array of massage therapies tailored to your individual needs, ensuring that every session is personalized. Visitors rave about the skilled therapists like Tatiana, who expertly blend relaxation techniques with deep tissue work to alleviate tension and soreness. The atmosphere is serene and welcoming, making it the perfect escape after long days of travel or physical activity.

sources.shortName: 8 Romantic Activities to Enjoy in Málaga

places.name: Sadhana Massage Málaga Center - Masajes en Málaga - Quiromasajista - Maderoterapia

reviews.text:
Amazing service and massages that I came here twice within my 2 day trip! 😌

I had the 30 minute cranial massage with Nieves and a 90 minute massage with Cristina. Both were amazing and service overall was great.

The place is very calm and peaceful with soft spa music in the background.

I asked in advanced and they had everything prepared before I got there so I could showered before and after massage since I had already checked out of my Airbnb.

Amazing experience and I would highly recommend!

We were warmly welcomed. The atmosphere was calm and relaxing, perfect for disconnecting. Marta and Peggy were our massage therapists, and they both did an excellent job: professional, attentive, and truly skilled. We left feeling refreshed and relaxed. A great experience from start to finish. Highly recommended if you're looking for a quality massage in Málaga.

I loved it! It was 60 minutes of pure relaxation and tranquility, right before my return  home. Flor received me very well, she was super friendly and, during the massage, she made sure that the pressure was pleasant and I was comfortable. It's really worth it!

places.address: Pl. de la Constitución, 2, Edificio Miramar 1ª planta, Distrito Centro, 29008 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Playas del Palo is a renowned beach located in the eastern part of Malaga, Spain, within the charming fisherman's quarter. The area is famous for its fresh seafood served in beach bars and restaurants. Accessible by public transport, it's a popular spot for international tourists due to the presence of Spanish schools nearby. This coastal gem offers small bays formed naturally by sand and rocks, providing a more tranquil atmosphere compared to other bustling beaches in Malaga.

sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Malaga for Couples

places.name: Playas del Palo

reviews.text: It has four white sand beaches created by five breakwaters. It is quiet and the current is not strong, so it is a place frequented by locals, especially families. There are good restaurants lined up along the beach.

Lovely beach and nice restaurants nearby.
Fine sand and you can rent a beach chair for 7€/ day, pity water is still too cold for swimming.

Highly recommendable beach area, one of our, if not our favorite beach in málaga. It is calm and not overrun by tourists, has a couple of nice bays and a prommenade.

if you wanna find out more about the area and our detailed playas del palo review go to travel - spain org

places.address: Spain

places.generalDescription: Playa de la Malagueta in Málaga is a popular city beach known for its long stretch of fine sand, seafood shacks, and nearby amenities. It's conveniently located just a 10-minute walk from the city center and offers a perfect setting for swimming and sunbathing. The beach is frequented by locals, giving visitors an authentic experience away from touristy crowds.

sources.snippet: It is a boutique hotel with unique architecture located in the historic center of Malaga, and at a practically similar distance from the port and Playa de la Malagueta and from the well-known Calle Larios.
sources.shortName: Romantic getaway to the Costa del Sol
15 Romantic Things to Do in Malaga for Couples

places.name: Playa de la Malagueta (Málaga)

reviews.text: Even in winter months, this place is magical, pretty clean and so close from old town. Grab a coffee to go and enjoy the unexpected sky each day here at this beach.

This beach is nice for views and restaurants only. Not for swimming (water is clear but quite cold even end August due to cold currents) and not for sunbathing in my opinion (I hated dusty dark sand that ruined my slides that were plastic! Just imagine what would happen to any better shoes). If you're visiting Malaga anyway and have couple spare hours to chill then it's a yes. If you're thinking of spending a beach vacation there then it's a hard no.
Cool beach literally next to city centre with vendors offering all kind of stuff, food & drinks so you don't have to go anywhere. My lazy me loved it 😄

places.address: Málaga, Spain

sources.snippet: On this tour, you will visit the Malaga Park, the Paseo de la Farola, the Paseo Marítimo, the Plaza de Toros and the Paseo de Reding, among others.
sources.shortName: Romantic getaway to the Costa del Sol

places.name: Paseo Marítimo Antonio Machado

reviews.text:
Perfect for relax or maybe you can read a book if you don't mind the traffic which is right by, but definitely you can have a run or walk in the morning even exercise or even swim coz the sea is right in front of this nice place.
-
Please don't forget to leave a thumbs-up because it will help me continue to upload new informations about locations
-
Check my
Instagram: ftfit24
Facebook: florinfitclub24
Amazing place for unhurried walks!
Màlaga is a beautiful city, with lovely beaches and absolutely amazing surroundings!

places.address: Autovía de Acceso al Puerto de Málaga, Carretera de Cádiz, 29002, Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Malaga, just a stone's throw from the majestic cathedral, Clarence Jazz Club stands as the city's premier destination for live jazz enthusiasts. This American-style venue exudes charm with its exposed brick walls and moody lighting, creating an inviting atmosphere for music lovers. Each night, visitors can immerse themselves in captivating performances by both local talents and international artists.

sources.snippet: Every Wednesday through Saturday you can enjoy concerts at the Clarence Jazz Club in Malaga. While the decoration is simple, this is a great option to start (or end) your romantic evening in Malaga. Make sure to check the website for tickets or special events.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things To Do In Malaga to Woo Your Special Someone

places.name: Clarence Jazz Club

reviews.text: Fantastic Little Jazz Club. The music was above what I expected. They charge you 10 euros to enter but you get a beer or water coupon with it.  Where are they fell down is they never came back to ask if I wanted anything else.  The club was comfortable had good air conditioning and the Acoustics were nice.

We bought 2 tickets in advance (stated 22.00 show start), when we arrived at about 21.50 the place looked empty and there were no signs of a show about to start. Despite this, the extremely helpful and efficient girl behind the bar explained the drill; our 10€ had gained us entry and a free drink, we could sit at the table and receive table service for the evening too.
The 'band' were slightly late and just before they started, the place seemed to fill up quite quickly; I can imagine it is busier as we move into the warmer months so advice would be to get there early if you want a good seat (there are probably about 30 great seats with tables, then another 20 or so around the edges, further but not too far away from the performance. Those who were late stayed towards the bar, and i suspect others who were just there to drink (you could hear the vibrant chatter behind but it wasn't too much of a distraction to not avoid the show; like I said, get there earlier.
The band consisted of 3 blokes, it was a jam sesh so others joined after the first interval; the main 3 drummer, bassist and guitarist. They were very good as were those who'd come to jam. It felt rather familiar despite the setting being quite smart and classy. We stayed until about 23.30 and another group were proficiently moved into our space. Service was excellent, I'm not sure how the young waitress with glasses on coped with the demand of the bar and table service, but she did...and very well too.
100% recommend this place on all levels.

Very cozy jazz club in the city center. Friendly and cordial staff, nice bands - both local and international - and wide selection of drinks. Also the entry is very reasonably priced so I'll keep coming back while in Torremolinos.

places.address: C. Danza Invisible, 8, 29620 Torremolinos, Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: La Sole del Pimpi is a chic venue that offers a fusion of Japanese and Mediterranean cuisines, complemented by an array of creative cocktails. As the sister establishment of the renowned El Pimpi, it provides an inventive menu featuring maki, tempura, and tapas. The restaurant prides itself on using local ingredients to create dishes that reflect the flavors of Malaga.

sources.snippet: The smaller sister of the famous bar and restaurant El Pimpi (a gastronomic icon of Malaga), La Sole del Pimpi is a sophisticated space where you can enjoy a refined international menu that fuses the best of Japanese and Mediterranean cuisines. The cocktails also have an incredible reputation and will put the cherry on the top of an already perfect evening. An ideal choice for a romantic lunch or dinner in Malaga capital.
sources.shortName: The most romantic restaurants in Malaga
8 Romantic Activities to Enjoy in Málaga

places.name: La Sole del Pimpi

reviews.text:
Wow! Such a historic place in the heart of Málaga.

We had several courses of tapas before the main dish and dessert. Everything that I tried was exceptional!

The sea bass with white garlic sauce was the standout protein, in my opinion. But surprisingly, the best thing I tasted there were roasted carrots and hummus. It was the perfect example of taking a basic ingredient and cooking it to perfection to make it a star!

If you are ever in Málaga, you have to eat here at least once.

It was an amazing experience! The ambience is beautiful and the music is jazzy. You have a beautiful view at the ruin. The waiter that helped us spoke perfect English and was very lovely. The food did not come to fast what we loved. The sushi was the best we ever had. We definitely recommend this place. Make sure that you reserve at the first floor at la Sole!!☀️

Simply amazing. The food is traditional and delicious. The tapas pairs so perfectly with beer and everything compliments each other. The octopus is the most tender I have ever eaten. Friendly staff, beautiful views of the ancient theatre and fort from the outside, and super efficient. A wonderful place to have dinner.

places.address: C. Zegrí, 4, Distrito Centro, 29015 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Malaga Port is a picturesque coastal area in Andalucia, known for its stunning views and vibrant atmosphere. It offers a pleasant mix of natural beauty and urban entertainment, with the Sierra Subbetica mountains providing a majestic backdrop to the bustling port. Visitors can unwind at plush bars overlooking the Palm Garden of Surprises, where they can enjoy cocktails or wine while watching the evening paseo along the port-side.

sources.snippet: Boats, palm trees, the sea and views out over the Mediterranean. This combination, enjoyable from Málaga’s stunning port and the “Palm Garden of Surprises” that stretches along its length, would be enough to melt even the most un-romantic of hearts. As well as being the second most important port for cruise ships in Spain, it is one of the dreamiest places in the city to take an early evening stroll with your partner, when you can watch the sunset over the floating mini-cities that drop anchor here.
sources.shortName: 12 Of The Most Romantic Spots In Málaga

places.name: Malaga Port

reviews.text:
Málaga's port, particularly Muelle Uno, is a fantastic destination during the Christmas season, offering a vibrant and festive atmosphere. The area combines open-air spaces with stunning views of yachts and the sea, creating a picturesque backdrop for holiday activities. Visitors can enjoy the Christmas market at Muelle Uno, which features over 50 stalls selling crafts, gourmet products, and festive treats. The market also includes activities like Santa visits and children's workshops, making it ideal for families.

The port area is lively even on Christmas Day, with restaurants and shops open for visitors. Dining options range from traditional Spanish cuisine to international offerings, allowing you to enjoy a meal by the sea while soaking in the holiday spirit[9]. The illuminated harbor and reflections of Christmas lights on the water add to the magical ambiance, especially at sunset.

Overall, Málaga's port is a must-visit spot during the holidays. Its combination of festive markets, scenic views, and a cheerful atmosphere makes it a memorable experience for locals and tourists alike.

Plenty to offer - shops, food, activities and views! All just amazing. It is clean. You could sit and watch the activity for hours. The sunsets I seen were beautiful. The stalls are a great local addition. And the walk is just breathtaking, you can walk the area and not spend a cent if you wish.
Quant but alive. Something for everybody. Food. Boat rides. Sunset cruises. Feels like the heart of the city lies on the ports

places.address: P.º del Muelle Uno, Distrito Centro, 29016 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: El Balneario - Baños del Carmen is a stylish restaurant located on the beautiful Playa Baños del Carmen beach in Malaga. It offers unspoiled views of the Mediterranean Sea and is known for its exquisite seafood, classic local dishes, and a wide range of international and Mediterranean cuisine. The restaurant's elegant and inviting ambiance makes it the perfect place to enjoy a drink or meal while watching stunning sunsets over the Costa del Sol.

sources.snippet: Somewhat of a landmark in the city, El Balneario is the only restaurant on beautiful Baños del Carmen beach; and the perfect place to gaze at stunning sunsets over the Costa del Sol with extraordinary views of the Mediterranean Sea and the city behind. The menu is defined by dishes that seek to find balance between the traditional and the avant garde while emanating the spirit of Malaga. There is, naturally, no shortage of espetos (sardine kebabs) and pescaíto frito (fried fish), two local dishes par excellence.
sources.shortName: The most romantic restaurants in Malaga

sources.snippet: The restaurant el balneario Malaga is an elegant and stimulating space in front of the sea with a wide range of European, Spanish, international and Mediterranean cuisine, including typical cuisine, fish and various specialities. A cosy and romantic space perfect for a wonderful evening full of flavours and pleasant sensations.
sources.shortName: The best romantic restaurants in Malaga

sources.snippet: Kick-start your romantic holiday in Malaga by dining at El Balneario. Positioned overlooking the sea, choose from one of the many outdoor tables to soak up the fantastic sea views. As the waves lap over the walls - which might lightly sprinkle you on a windier day - tuck into a variety of traditional Spanish dishes.
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Malaga

places.name: El Balneario - Baños del Carmen

reviews.text: We went at 1230 staff were nice and let us wait in there until lunch is served at 1300. Not cheap but nice views in front of the sea where you can feel the splash. Service great and fresh food. Tried the malaga fish soup. Not the usual soup flavour that I imagine with a “ cream soup”  but it turned out very nice and refreshing

Came here 10 years ago for the first time. My favorite place I always have to go to when I'm in Malaga. Although the restaurant really needs some maintenance, the terrace outside is huge, the view over the sea is breathtaking. Some of the staff are friendly and some are not (Ossama was our very nice and friendly waiter). Loved the tapas (patatas bravas is different but oh so delicious 😋). And the sea bass from the BBQ was fantastic and yummy😍. This is not the place for a quick lunch. But if you have time like we did, enjoy the food, the view over the sea and the sun. We had a great time sitting there for 3,5 hours🥰🥰

Pricing not in accordance with the menu, so we were surprised when we paid 12€ instead of the 9€ we had expected. We came for drinks only, so can't judge the food. But the drinks were with 3 huge ice cubes. See picture. Come on guys...i didn't order ice cubes. However, a great place to sit with views

places.address: C/ Bolivia, 26, Málaga-Este, 29018 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: La Terraza De Valeria is a rooftop lounge located at the Room Mate Valeria Hotel in Malaga, offering stunning views of the harbor and city landmarks. It's open to both guests and non-guests, providing a perfect spot to enjoy refreshing drinks like fruit smoothies, daiquiris, and mojitos during the day or passionfruit martinis in the evening.

sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Malaga for Couples

places.name: Bar La Terraza De Valeria

reviews.text: Nice terrace, a beautiful atmosphere, good Lavazza coffee and nice cocktails. The price of water is a bit high in my point of view, but anything else is very good. Also, nice area dedicated to the hotel's clients. The view is incredible and the music too.

A delightful rooftop bar located atop the Room Mate Valeria Hotel. The staff were incredibly friendly; when we arrived, all the tables were occupied except for spots at the bar. However, they kindly informed us when a table became available and asked if we wanted it. The quality of the drinks was impressive; I particularly enjoyed their sangria and espresso martini. The bar offers a stunning view for watching the sunset, making it a fantastic spot for a sundowner.

We had a great time here! The bar is located on top of a hotel, just a short distance from the port. We went on a Sunday evening without a reservation and had no issues. The staff were very friendly, the cocktails were tasty, and they even served drinks with nuts on the side. The view from the bar was lovely as well

places.address: Plaza Poeta Alfonso Canales, 5, Distrito Centro, 29001 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Located in the El Palo district, Candado Beach offers an ideal setting to celebrate special occasions in a stylish ambiance. With stunning views of the Mediterranean and El Candado port, this restaurant showcases local ingredients and is particularly known for its delicious rice dishes. It is undoubtedly a fantastic choice for a romantic dinner in Malaga. This beachside establishment is conveniently situated within the city, making it perfect for those who prefer not to travel far but still want to enjoy a pleasant atmosphere.

sources.snippet: Situated in El Palo district, Candado Beach is the perfect space to celebrate a special occasion in chic surroundings. Affording impressive views over the Mediterranean and El Candado port, the restaurant’s cuisine shines the spotlight on local produce and is renowned for its rice dishes. Doubtlessly a wonderful option for a romantic dinner in Malaga.
sources.shortName: The most romantic restaurants in Malaga

sources.snippet: Located in the sports harbour, it’s an idyllic spot for a memorable romantic evening. Its menu focuses on authentic Andalusian roots and is very reasonably priced, between 25 to 30 euros per person.
sources.shortName: The most romantic spots of Málaga

places.name: Candado Beach | Restaurante, bodas y eventos en Málaga

reviews.text:
We have experience Candado Beach in different situations where we were delighted about their professionalism. Me and my wife got married in this beautiful venue. The food was amazing, the service was over our expectations (what a team! Thank you!), management was really helpful and kind (thanks Carla!). At the same time we have being eating lunch in the restaurant a couple of times. Best paella ever. Their tuna tartare is delicious. And their desserts… omg! Congratulations to the chefs!
No matter if you're a local or if you're just passing by Malaga, this is your place! Amazing food with sea view! Highly recommended!

We celebrated our wedding here and from day Rocio and her staff were amazing. Not only is the location beautiful, but each staff member is helpful and accommodating. Rocio organized the day perfectly and everything we wanted, she made sure to make it happen. Our guests complimented the food, the service, and overall the organization of the event. We recommend candado beach for any event, you can trust they will take care of you.

Best lunch in the last weeks: El Candado Beach Restaurant today. The wine list is really good and the food wonderful creative and tasty. A real highlight of this springs food tasting tour. Boquerones, meijillones, tuna, cannelon de aguacate and a fish/seafood soup (probably the best outside of Marseille).

places.address: Club Náutico, Carretera de Almerìa la Araña, s/n, Málaga-Este, 29018 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Playa Peñon del Cuervo, also known as Raven Rock Beach, is a stunning and secluded beach in Malaga. It offers a quieter and more relaxed atmosphere compared to other beaches in the area. The wide sandy beach is famous for its crystal-clear waters and features a prominent rock formation that divides it into two sections. Visitors can enjoy picnics, barbecues, and leisure activities at this protected biological enclave surrounded by rocky cliffs.

sources.snippet: If you’re looking for a more secluded spot to enjoy the sunset or a picnic at the beach Peñón del Cuervo is the place you’re looking for!. This wild beach with unique rock formation is a perfect place for a romantic day!. It is located east of Malaga Center, a little further form El Palo district.
sources.shortName: 7 most romantic spots in Malaga

places.name: Playa Peñon del Cuervo

reviews.text: Fantastic place! Playa Penon offers breathtaking views that capture the essence of Málaga's natural beauty. The peaceful atmosphere made it a perfect spot to relax and unwind, away from the city's usual hustle and bustle. The scenery was truly stunning, and it felt like a hidden gem with fewer crowds, which added to the serene experience. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a quiet escape with spectacular landscapes.
The beach is beautiful, a pleasant place to enjoy. Restrooms are open until 8 p.m., and are super cleans. It has a barbecue area.

A beautiful beach with a wild touch, free parking right next to it, and a bar where you can order food and drinks. There are also showers available. Although the beach itself has small pebbles, once you step into the water you'll find incredibly soft and pleasant sand. Fall in love with this beach!

places.address: Carretera de Almerìa la Araña, Málaga-Este, 29017 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Toro Muelle Uno is a popular Spanish restaurant in the heart of Muelle Uno on the harbor. The menu includes traditional dishes made with local produce, and offers stunning views from its modern but charming decor. The service here is always good, and the food is generally tasty and well-executed. Highlights include grilled tuna, pork cheeks, and ham and cheese starter.

sources.snippet: Located in an idyllic and luminous marine environment, the Toro muelle uno offers a genuine cuisine that combines tradition and avant-garde with a marked commitment to the gastronomic richness of the area. They specialise in grills and seafood, but there are options for all tastes and needs. Undoubtedly, a perfect occasion to start an unforgettable evening while savouring the best Malaga dishes and tapas with unbeatable views in the background.
sources.shortName: The best romantic restaurants in Malaga

places.name: TORO Muelle Uno

reviews.text: Absolutely delicious food! We shared the grilled 🐙, a refreshing tomato salad with 🥑 and tuna, and the flavorful pimientos de padrón. Each dish was incredibly tasty and well-prepared-definitely a great meal!

We ordered oxtail, based on photos from other visitors - it looked great in the pictures. In reality, they didn't ask which kind of potatoes we wanted, and the ones we got felt like they were from the day before.
The oxtail itself was decent, but didn't feel very fresh either - maybe that's normal since it requires long cooking.
The service, however, was good.
3rd night in the city and this restaurant was so far the best. Food was amazing. Views were just as good.

places.address: P.º de la Farola, Local 65, Distrito Centro, 29001 Málaga, Spain

sources.snippet: In addition, you have the Suites del Pintor and the Casas del Pintor , tourist apartments in the center of Malaga, find out at our reception or telephone.
sources.shortName: Romantic getaway to the Costa del Sol

places.name: La Casa del Pintor

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Great professionals help you buy the most appropriate thing to do your renovation. Very good prices for the quality of the paint, which is excellent. Color mixing machine and wallpaper ect... Whenever I need paint I go, a 10

(Original)
Grandes profesionales te ayudan a comprar lo más adecuado para hacer tu reforma. Precios muy buenos para la calidad de la pintura q es excelente. Maquina de mezcla de colores y papel pintado ect... Siempre q necesito pintura voy, un 10

(Translated by Google) After having searched a lot we found this store where the treatment is quite professional. The quality of the paint is very good, we bought the top one from their brand for interiors. It covers well and we have already tried washing it from time to time (we have 2 children and a dog...). Happy with your advice and materials.

(Original)
Después de haber buscado bastante encontramos esta tienda donde el trato es bastante profesional. La calidad de la pintura es muy buena, compramos la superior de su marca para interiores. Cubre bien y ya hemos probado a lavarla alguna que otra vez (tenemos 2 niños y perra...). Contentos con su asesoramiento y sus materiales.

(Translated by Google) Impressive treatment and very good professionals. I have been buying paintings from them for many years and will continue. Thanks to Carlos, Carmen and Paco

(Original)
Un trato impresionante y muy buenos profesionales. Llevo comprandoles pinturas muchísimos años y seguiré. Gracias a Carlos, Carmen y Paco

places.address: Av. de los Vegas, 15, Cruz de Humilladero, 29006 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Restaurante Balausta is a charming eatery located in the heart of Malaga, within the 18th-century Solecio palace. The restaurant offers a blend of contemporary and traditional Andalusian cuisine with an avant-garde touch. Chef Jose Carlos Garcia presents artful dishes that reimagine bygone Andalusian recipes, catering to diverse palates. The extensive menu ensures there's something for everyone, making it a great choice for families and friends looking to enjoy Mediterranean fusion cuisine.

sources.shortName: 8 Romantic Activities to Enjoy in Málaga

places.name: Restaurante Balausta

reviews.text: I reserved there for valentine's day dinner and it was amazing. The food was exceptional and the wine too! The service is impeccable and everyone was so nice. I sent them an email before arriving that i was pregnant and would love if they don't use raw meat or eggs for dinner, and the response came back positive. Perfect dinner.

One of the best food experiences in Málaga!
The chef is absolutely amazing - every dish was crafted with precision, flavor, and creativity. A true culinary gem that made our visit unforgettable.
The absolute best meal we have had in Spain. From the attentiveness of the staff to the freshness of every dish- I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a fine dining experience in Malaga!

places.address: C. Granada, 57-59, Distrito Centro, 29015 Málaga, Spain

places.generalDescription: El Hammam Open Space & SPA offers a traditional Andalusian experience with its Turkish steam baths and serene atmosphere. The spa's architecture reflects the cultural legacy of Al-Andalus, providing a peaceful and clean environment for relaxation. Guests can enjoy hot stone treatments and self-scrubbing with black soap in this tranquil setting. Additionally, the friendly staff ensures a warm welcome and excellent massage services, making it an ideal spot for a relaxing date night.

sources.shortName: 8 Romantic Activities to Enjoy in Málaga

places.name: El Hammam Open Space & SPA

reviews.text:
Traditional Hammam.
Really clean, peaceful (if respectful), lacking nothing.
Forbidden to photograph inside the spa of course but from the photos I could take and share, you can see the quality of the establishment.
Inside the spa as painted beautifully, water running in almost every corner. The stone, especially the steps and the hexagonal stone table are just hot enough, like perfect.
For only a couple of € more, I was given the black soap and scrubbing mitt to self scrub but book in. Advance for their renowned excellent scrub massages and or list of other massages.
Really loved the peace I felt here.

A must go to kick-start your sunny days and cool air nights x

Wonderfully Hammam experience. Peaceful, relaxing, cleansing......it was perfect after an enthralling day of exploring Málaga, This was the ideal way to unwind. The black soap and exfoliant were great. I selected to have exfoliation treatment but instead was taken for a massage. I didn't raise a question as the massage was fantastic, the masseuse had healing hands. The lemon oil was especially good. Finished off with time to unwind on the rooftop terrace with a grand view of the cathedral

Date night with my wife - very relaxing! The staff were so friendly and welcoming. We relaxed in the baths for a bit, before they called us upstairs for our massages together. Note that we picked the separate therapeutic (strong) massages, not the relaxing massages that are experienced in the main baths. Our massages were great. It's also worth noting that this is a traditional spa where there are no pools, just peaceful, beautiful rooms with hot water flowing all around to pour over yourself. Then we had tea up on the rooftop balcony overlooking the city (see photos - beautiful - but can't take pictures inside the spa). Definitely recommended!

places.address: C/ Tomás de Cózar, 13, Distrito Centro, 29008 Málaga, Spain
